intro: Morisonia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate with a rough, hairy texture, and the stems are often covered in a reddish-brown pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and wetlands.
